alert.note: Alert for Benton; Carroll; Crawford; Franklin; Madison; Sebastian; Washington (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 23 at 9:14AM CST until February 24 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Areas of moderate to heavy sleet with embedded thunder will continue over much of eastern Oklahoma and northwest Arkansas into the afternoon hours. Total sleet accumulations of one inch are likely with a locally heavier band of two inches along and north of I-40, extending to I-44. Across far southeast Oklahoma and west-central Arkansas, sleet mixed with freezing rain is likely with ice accumulations of one tenth to one half of an inch through Thursday. Another round of freezing rain and sleet will spread back into the region Thursday morning. Some additional ice and sleet accumulations will be likely before the wintry precipitation shifts east by late Thursday afternoon. * WHERE...Portions of east central, northeast and southeast Oklahoma and northwest and west central Arkansas. * WHEN...From 6 AM Wednesday to 6 PM CST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage will be possible across southeast Oklahoma and northwest Arkansas due to the ice. Roads will likely be slick and very hazardous, which will likely impact the morning and evening commute. Travel is not recommended unless necessary.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. In Arkansas, for the latest road conditions call 1-800-245- 1672 or go to idrivearkansas.com. In Oklahoma, for the latest road conditions call 1-844-465-4997 or go to okRoads.org.
